item.title: Automating Browser Screenshots for Social Media using wcap and Pillow
item.description: An article describing how I automated the creation of social media images for two websites with graphics rendered in JavaScript by using screenshots.

item.title: Drawing Ramones Style Circular Text with D3.js
item.description: Example JavaScript on how to draw circular text as seen in the Ramones logo with SVG paths and SVG text elements using the D3.js API.

item.title: Customizing Matplotlib's Plotting Styles
item.description: A tutorial on how to customize the look and feel of plots created with the Matplotlib library for Python.

item.title: Gender Comparison: Would you Tell your Weight?
item.description: A look at the results of a poll about whether people disclose their body weight and how to present results of such a pool using data visualization.

item.title: Automating Browser Tasks without Distraction on Ubuntu
item.description: How to automate browser tasks on Ubuntu using Selenium from Python without displaying a browser window.

item.title: Drawing the New York Hardcore Logo with D3.js
item.description: Example JavaScript code of how you can draw the New York Hardcore (NYHC) logo with D3.js using SVG shapes and text.

item.title: Drawing Crosshairs with D3.js Using SVG Shapes
item.description: Example JavaScript code of how you can draw SVG crosshairs with D3.js using SVG shapes.

item.title: Python Script to Delete Delicious Bookmarks
item.description: A Python script to delete all bookmarks from the Delicious bookmarking service for the authenticated user.

item.title: (Ab)using Pandas to Migrate Disqus Threads
item.description: A short tutorial on how to use the pandas Python toolkit to create a URL map for migrating Disqus comment threads.

item.title: Quick and Dirty Site Monitoring with Google Apps Script
item.description: A tutorial on how to use Google Drive and Apps Script to set up a free Website monitoring service that runs on Google's infrastructure.

item.title: Taking Web Page Screenshots with PhantomJS and Python
item.description: A brief tutorial on how to create screenshots with common browser resolutions and save them as PNG files using PhantomJS and Python.

item.title: Diving into Ruby, Sinatra and MongoDB on OpenShift
item.description: A howto on creating and running an application using Ruby, Sinatra and MongoDB on Redhat's OpenShift platform for hosting apps in the cloud.
